head.title: The Special Bond That Siblings Share

hedline.hl1: The Special Bond That Siblings Share

abstract.p: Robin Beckhard James letter on unique relationships between siblings (S)

block.p: Re ''When Every Child Is an Only Child,'' by Eugenie Allen (Op-Ed, May 19):
Re ''When Every Child Is an Only Child,'' by Eugenie Allen (Op-Ed, May 19):

Sibling relationships are indeed both unique and precious, and can be a source of great strength and comfort. I have observed over the 11 years since my former husband and I separated that the bond between our two children has helped them navigate the shoals of two different homes, different rules, different styles. The sibling is the constant, the touchstone, the reality check.

Two very different people, they have their disagreements, but are fiercely supportive of each other. (All the years of saying, ''I'll be the mom, you be the sister [or brother]'' when one or the other would come to ''rat'' on the other seem to have paid off.)
Not only am I grateful to have my children -- I am also grateful that they have each other.
ROBIN BECKHARD JAMES New York, May 19, 2000
